abstracts.cdata!:
The ratings show satisfactory outcomes,
            and likely sustainability. However, and despite a
            satisfactory appraisal, the lack of understanding during
            appraisal, of the precise collaborative roles of the
            Inter-ministerial Commission for Privatization, and sector
            ministries, complicated project design, since the assumption
            of Government commitments to the project, under-estimated
            the potential opposition to privatization from state
            enterprises, unions, and political elements, aggravated by
            over-estimating incentives in establishing independent
            regulatory bodies for the newly privatized companies. Thus
            lessons convey the need to ensure political commitment to
            privatization during project preparation, and, to understand
            the precise implications of its privatization process. And,
            particularly in light of imperfect markets, where monopolies
            still persist, regulatory strengthening should be
            established prior to privatization itself.
